section.title: Overview of the GeneSEZ approach
section.para:
An MDSD platform based on the GeneSEZ meta-model was created. A schematic representation of this is shown in
.

figure.title: Schematic overview of the GeneSEZ approach

section.para: Following concepts are characteristic for the main component:

listitem.para: The GeneSEZ Core Meta-Model as central component, which provides information for source code generation in a preprocessed form and is used for model transformation.
Model-adapters are used to create GeneSEZ models with information from the application models.
The GeneSEZ components as function libraries and common basis for generation of source code in different programming languages.
The platform-projects provide source code templates for the respective programming language together with libraries and frameworks for the source code generation.

section.para: The application models can be created and elaborated regardless of the MDSD-platform. With model-adapters the relevant data for source code generation will be extracted from the application models and then transformed into GeneSEZ-models. Based on this GeneSEZ-model more model transformations can be done until a model-to-text transformation for source code generation is performed and the source code artifacts are generated automatically. In most cases complete source code cannot be generated in a manner that makes sense. Therefore the source code must be completed with manual implementation.

Its not necessary to do these steps in these order. After a first version of an application model is available, it can be transformed into a GeneSEZ model and thereafter the source code can be generated. This source code can be extended with manual implementation. While the application model is still elaborated, it can frequently be transformed into source code where the manual implementations will remain. This iterative procedure allows backflow of information that arise from implementation to the application modeling. There these information can be used to enhance the application model.

A significant advantage in the development of model transformations is the possibility to print the GeneSEZ meta-model complete on two DIN-A4 sites and use them as an overview on how specific information can be accessed.
